CatDescriptText: Norma Wilson, housewife, Terrace Village I and Evelyn Davenport, hotel employee, Uptown, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 7, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think Red China should be admitted to the United Nations?"  Mrs. Wilson's answer reads: "Definitely not...They wouldn't do any good...There would be more dissension."  Mrs. Davenport's answer reads: "I don't think so...There's enough confusion in the UN and there is no need for anymore, which would be the case if Red China were admitted."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Norma Wilson wearing textured coat with rounded collar, standing in front of store window with sale signs, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Evelyn Davenport wearing leather coat and eyeglasses, holding paper bag with two sticks, standing in front of C.C. Mellors, Smithfield Street, Downtown
